panels.description: Number of user requests delivered from cache.
panels.title: HITS /sec

panels.description: Average millisecond interval from a cache receiving a HTTP request to it sending a cached response's first byte. Also know as Time-To-First-Byte (TTFB).
panels.title: HIT TIME /sec (in ms)

panels.description: Number of user requests for objects not in cache (i.e. cache miss).
panels.title: MISSES /sec

panels.description: Requests delivered from cache divided by the number of cacheable requests (hits + misses).
panels.title: HIT RATIO /sec

panels.description: Average ms interval from when a cache issues a HTTP request to the origin to when the response is received.
panels.title: MISS TIME /sec (in ms)

panels.description: Total number of requests received in a second.
panels.title: REQUESTS /sec

panels.description: Number of user requests producing an error.
panels.title: ERRORS /sec

panels.description: Number of user requests delivered from cache.
panels.title: HITS total

panels.description: Average millisecond interval from a cache receiving a HTTP request to it sending a cached response's first byte. Also know as Time-To-First-Byte (TTFB).
panels.title: HIT TIME total (in ms)

panels.description: Number of user requests for objects not in cache (i.e. cache miss).
panels.title: MISSES total

panels.description: Requests delivered from cache divided by the number of cacheable requests (hits + misses).

targets.expr:
sum(increase(fastly_rt_hits_total{service_name=~"$service_name", service_id=~"$service_id", datacenter=~"$datacenter"}[$__range])) / (sum(increase(fastly_rt_hits_total{service_name=~"$service_name", service_id=~"$service_id", datacenter=~"$datacenter"}[$__range]))
+ sum(increase(fastly_rt_miss_total{service_name=~"$service_name", service_id=~"$service_id", datacenter=~"$datacenter"}[$__range])))

panels.title: HIT RATIO total

panels.description: Average ms interval from when a cache issues a HTTP request to the origin to when the response is received.
panels.title: MISS TIME total (in ms)

panels.description: Total number of requests received in a second.
panels.title: REQUESTS total

panels.description: Number of user requests producing an error.
panels.title: ERRORS total

panels.description: The amount of bandwidth served for you site by Fastly.
panels.title: BANDWIDTH

panels.description: The total number of requests that were received for your site by Fastly.
panels.title: REQUESTS

panels.description: Displays a histogram showing the distribution of origin latency times.  This tells you how quickly your origin is responding to Fastly.
panels.title: ORIGIN LATENCY

panels.description: Hit ratio is defined as the proportion if cache hits to all cacheable content (hits + misses). Increasing your hit ratio improves the overall performance benefit of using Fastly.
panels.title: HIT RATIO

panels.description: This number reflects a variety of errors, which can include calls on vcl_error.
panels.title: ERRORS
